instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
There was no green/amber light on MagSafe. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and PP3V42 present but issue with the <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> signal in the SMC.
- SMC area was corroded. Performed SMC reflow and replaced 4 components around it.
- MLB turned on after this but there was liquid damage in various other sections.
- J9500 (IOB Micro-coax connector) cleaned up.
- <CHIP>U3711</CHIP> (SSD S0 switch was reflowed and one cap was replaced.
- 2 components were replaced near the left speaker connector.
- KBB connector was also cleaned.
- Also replaced 3 caps behind the CPU.

[B]After this[/B]
- Turning on and booting from the internal drive. Very slow booting.
- Not booting into Catalina from an external drive.
- Booted into Sierra from an external drive. Still booting slow. Works fine once logged into OS. 
- Did full testing. 
- While changing the display/KBD brightness and volume levels. Slow animation.

What should I do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
ALWAYS reball SMC, when corrosion is detected on its area!
Very likely, in this case, SMC doesn't get information from all sensors.

Run corresponding EFI ASD.
HWMonitor can also show helpfull information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
Hi,

I did SMC reball and installed another one from doner, same booting slow in Catalina
Also tried a BIOS with clean ME, no go.

In HWMonitor, what values should I look at?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
Any strabge value.
Post screenshot, if needed.

Didn't run EFI ASD yet?
It is a basic test, in such case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
This is 2014 MacBook Pro. can i run EFI ASD on this? If yes, how?
Do you have the link to download?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is from 2015, no ASD officially available. ASD for 2013 can be modded to partially run on 2015.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/ASD_List[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - Not booting in Catalina
threads.message:
Pufff, I didn't pay atention to board model.
I asked about ASD test viewing posted year.

Post HWMonitor screen shot...
